body.p:
218
Nov. 1st 3
Capt. Wm B. Craddock
Comm'dg Co. Capital Guards.
Frankfort -- Ky.
Captain,

According to arrangements made by the Governor with the United States authorities, your company as soon as full, will be at once mustered into the service of the United States. This will relieve our poor State already much in debt, of a large burden, for the U. S. will pay equip and subsist the troops, while they will still remain entirely subject to the orders of the Governor, and serve as Guards for the city of Frankfort and the surrounding territory.

You and your company are eminently fortunate in thus becoming the guardians of our immediate defense for no contingency will ever arise, to require your removal from our midst, and being under the direct control of our Governor, will have the best opportunity of protecting the Capital of your State, without being compelled to serve beyond its limits.

Respectfully
Your obt Serv't
John Boyle
Adjt. Gen. of Ky
